byline.contributor: Richard Oppel Jr. reported from New York and Helene Cooper from Washington
byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and HELENE COOPER

abstract: Sgt Bowe Bergdahl, accused of deserting Army base in eastern Afghanistan in 2009, also faces more obscure, and serious, charge of 'misbehavior before the enemy'; provision, which carries potential life sentence, is likely to be centerpiece of military's case against Bergdahl.
lead_paragraph: Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl is facing the serious charge that includes endangering the safety or a unit or outpost.

headline.main: In Bergdahl Case, the Rare Charge of Misbehavior
headline.print_headline: In Bergdahl Case, the Rare Charge of Misbehavior

snippet: Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl is facing the serious charge that includes endangering the safety or a unit or outpost.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
